data.title: Happy Family Place
data.text: We happened upon Sundance Square by accident and found it enchanting during Christmas. Everyone was dressed up and so happy. Kids were well behaved and lot of families.  We walked around and sampled chocolate at a chocolate shop & had drinks in a local bars. Very nice experience! I wish we built something like this where I live.

data.title: Red Room Karaoke
data.text: We had a group of eight on Saturday night and after dinner we wanted to do something "out of the box."  The chalkboard sign on the sidewalk said Comedy Club at the top and Karaoke on the bottom...we did the signing.  You go down the basement two flights and you definitely feel you've possibly made a bad choice but...you eventually reach the Red Room Bar and Stage.  It was a small audience..maybe 25 people...but virtually everyone got involved in the signing AND DANCING!  It was a lot of fun.  Definitely different - even from a typical karaoke bar.

data.title: Just fun..even with 95 degree temps at night.
data.text: We enjoyed just sitting near the water splash fountain and enjoying the atmosphere in the evenings.  There wasn't even a concert but it's well patrolled and lit up with everyone sitting and talking.  The splash fountain is only open for the kids at specific times of the day.

data.title: great addition to downtown
data.text: The square provides a meeting place and focal point for down town. There are nice public restrooms, shaded areas provided by huge umbrellas, water attractions< one that children can play in, nearby places to eat, the large mural is preserved. parking on street and nearby parking garage. There is adequate private security as well as city police. Good spot to rest, have a drink and watch people
